page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY CORN MILL
page.content: The old corn mill was built around 1685 and was used for grinding corn.It was powered by water from the stream called Cwmshenkin.The water wheel drives the cogs round which drives the grindstones to grind the corn.Grain was used to feed animals and make bread.The farmers brought it to be ground at the mill.Mr. Cuthbert Jones the owner did not live in the mill,he lived at Govilon House.The workers lived at the cottages near the mill.The cogs inside the mill were made out of wood and the main building was made from Welsh stone.The mill wheel does not work any more and the outside of it is not original,but the inside is.The work was completed in 1978 and the present owners are Mr. and Mrs. Booth.
